column4: Hi Guys, I am a newbee to Linux.  I cant write or copy anything in the '/' partition. All other partitions seem Ok ! What should I look for ?
YES
root@172.24.200.50:/# echo "ASFSFD" > sa
-bash: sa: Read-only file system
root@172.24.200.50:/# echo "ASFSFD" > sa
-bash: sa: Read-only file system
so perhaps it is read only.  What is the output of the command "mount"
: For the '/' partition is gives "/dev/sda3 on / type ext2 (rw)"
odd, rw indicates that it is writable.  Are you using ubuntu or did you choose ext2 when you installed?
: Yes I am using ubuntu and I need to use ext2
what is the output of:  ls -l /
: All dirs under / have perms "rwxr-xr-x" and owner "root root"
try ls -ld /   too like Loose said,
is home part of / or on another partition?
I guess the question is:  can you write to other places?
within the same partition
I am basically out of ideas too.  You might try unmounting / and remounting it.
: I can write to other partitions. I tried on one and succeeded !
Looce : OK. Let me try it ! THANK YOU VERY MUCH guys.
sorry we couldn't really help.
: I appreciate your help. I will let you guys know if I find something. THANK YOU.
